content.description:
Wacko climbs an overhang with fun movement on poor rock over a perfect landing.

Sit start with hands matched on the huge shelf. From there, place a heel in the hueco, make a big move to a right hand edge, crank up to a rail at the lip (there is an intermediate blunt feature if you prefer) with the left hand, match, then finish straight up the bumps to reach an easy mantel.

The wall just right of the problem is off for this problem. Despite the contrivance, I didn't feel like it at all affected the natural climb of the problem.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work fine. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the center of the prominent south face overhang on Nephele.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of edges at the base of the overhanging arete. From there, work up the edges to the lip, climb out the overhang on slopers to an edge at the end, then climb up the remainder using the bumps/edges to reach a mantle.
content.protection: A pair of pads worked well. The landing doesn't get any better than this.
content.location: It climbs southwest overhanging arete of Nephele.

content.description: Sit start at the base of the overhanging arete. From there, tranverse right along the shelf, when it ends, and climb up and right on the highly featured face to reach an easy finish.
content.protection: A pad or two or three or four. Bottom line, the landing is great, and the problem never really gets far off the ground except for the finish.
content.location: It traverses the south face of Nephele.
